content:
• Tuesday, June 12, 2012
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC) seeks to file paperwork with U.S. regulators as early as next month for a...

    US Airways (LCC) seeks to file paperwork with U.S. regulators as early as next month for a proposed merger with bankrupt AMR (AAMRQ.PK), Reuters reports. LCC is said to believe a regulatory filing before rather than after reaching a deal would bolster its case as AMR's creditors compare the merits of a merger with a stand-alone restructuring plan. LCC +1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • DDD

    3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) -5.4% AH after announcing a $100M stock offering. Given a market cap of...

    3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) -5.4% AH after announcing a $100M stock offering. Given a market cap of $1.63B as of today's close, the offering stands to dilute existing shareholders by over 6%. The 3D printer vendor says it intends to use the proceeds to finance future acquisitions, and for working capital and general corporate purposes. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • CASY

    More on Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY): FQ4 misses as gas margin was down approx. $0.02...

    More on Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY): FQ4 misses as gas margin was down approx. $0.02 cents y/y, reducing EPS by approx. $0.12 cents. Same-store gas gallons sold rose 2.5% with an average margin of $0.137 cents per gallon. Raises quarterly dividend to $0.165/share from $0.15. Sees FY13 same-store grocery, other merchandise sales up 6.2%; gas gallons sold up 1.0%, with an average margin of $0.14 cents per gallon.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • SMG

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG) says it will fall short of its previous FY12 sales growth and...

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG) says it will fall short of its previous FY12 sales growth and earnings guidance, citing slowing consumer demand following an early start to the lawn care season in Q2. Additionally, the gardening season, which traditionally peaks in mid-to late-May, has also not met expectations. Gross margins will also disappoint, due primarily to an unfavorable product mix, unplanned distribution costs and reduced leverage of fixed costs. Shares -11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD) +3% AH after initiating a quarterly dividend of $0.08/share. That's good for a...

    Dell (DELL-OLD) +3% AH after initiating a quarterly dividend of $0.08/share. That's good for a yield of 2.7% at current levels. Until now, the company has focused on returning cash to shareholders via massive stock buybacks that have failed to keep its stock price from flagging. The dividend announcement comes ahead of Dell's 2012 analyst meeting (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 6 Comments
  • CASY

    Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY): FQ4 EPS of $0.61 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $1.75B...

    Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY): FQ4 EPS of $0.61 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $1.75B (+13.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • JBLU

    JetBlue Airways (JBLU -3%) slides after posting slightly weaker than anticipated May traffic...

    JetBlue Airways (JBLU -3%) slides after posting slightly weaker than anticipated May traffic results. Traffic in May increased 7.4% Y/Y, on a capacity increase of just 4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • APOL

    Stocks of for-profit educators slide on rumors of renewed U.S. Senate interest in a ban against...

    Stocks of for-profit educators slide on rumors of renewed U.S. Senate interest in a ban against the schools' use of revenue from federal financial aid toward advertising, marketing and recruitment: APOL -3.4%, CECO -3.2%, DV -3.4%, STRA -3.4%, COCO -1.5%, EDMC -2%, ESI-OLD -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN +2.3%) gains after Aegis Capital initiated the shares with a Buy this morning and a...

    Amarin (AMRN +2.3%) gains after Aegis Capital initiated the shares with a Buy this morning and a 12-month price target of $25. Aegis cites the "compelling efficacy" of the company's lead drug candidate, a heart drug derived from fish oil. Aegis notes the drug's ability to not only lower high levels of triglycerides but also LDL levels gives it an advantage over current omega-3 fatty acid- derived drugs currently on the market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +9.8%) and Vivus (VVUS +2.9%) both move higher today after Five Star...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +9.8%) and Vivus (VVUS +2.9%) both move higher today after Five Star Equities issued a press release highlighting their weight loss drugs, saying they may be the first in a lucrative market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • SAVE

    Spirit Airlines (SAVE +2.7%) gets a boost on positive comments from Citigroup's Stephen Trent...

    Spirit Airlines (SAVE +2.7%) gets a boost on positive comments from Citigroup's Stephen Trent today, saying the stock has hit a four-month low and created an attractive entry point. Trent adds that after meeting with management last week, he's come away convinced that the company has a business model that "clearly works. The firm reiterates a Buy on the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • GWW

    Grainger's (GWW +0.8%) sales trends could accelerate end of 2012, says William Blair. The firm...

    Grainger's (GWW +0.8%) sales trends could accelerate end of 2012, says William Blair. The firm says that despite May average daily sales growth missing expectations, it was actually anticipating a bigger miss, and trends have improved from April. It keeps an Outperform rating on the stock and believes sales trends could accelerate towards the end of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +6%) has been especially volatile over the last 2 days - shares fell 12%...

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +6%) has been especially volatile over the last 2 days - shares fell 12% yesterday before bouncing today. Likely playing a role are reports CEO Robert Pera has bought the Memphis Grizzlies for ~$350M. Herb Greenberg, who last week voiced concerns over Ubiquiti's accounting, wonders how many shares of Ubiquiti (market cap $1.1B) Pera will have to sell to buy the Grizzlies, and how much of a distraction the purchase will be.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • LTM

    Brazilian airline Tam (TAM +5.5%) says it will delay a share-swap auction to June 22 to give...

    Brazilian airline Tam (TAM +5.5%) says it will delay a share-swap auction to June 22 to give shareholders more time to approve its merger with Lan Airlines (LFL -0.5%) that would create Latin America’s largest airline. The number of holdouts among Tam's minority shareholders surprises analysts, but the takeover is not likely to be derailed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK +3.3%) pops on rumors it has hired Goldman Sachs to facilitate a sale. SanDisk...

    SanDisk (SNDK +3.3%) pops on rumors it has hired Goldman Sachs to facilitate a sale. SanDisk sports a low valuation (1.7x estimated 2012 sales), but also carries a market cap of $8.7B, and operates in a capex-intensive business that's occasionally subject to massive price declines. OCZ Technology (OCZ +7.4%) and STEC (STEC +3.1%), which compete with SanDisk's solid-state drive business, are also rallying.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • DPS-OLD

    Dr Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD +2%) hits its highs for the day after being upgraded to Outperform at...

    Dr Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD +2%) hits its highs for the day after being upgraded to Outperform at Wells Fargo this morning. Wells says earnings growth should accelerate in 2013 due to lower commodity costs, and raises its price target range to $45 - $47 from $36 - $38.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM

  • Why are stocks rallying when "Europe’s crisis is completely unresolved?" asks MarketBeat....

    Why are stocks rallying when "Europe’s crisis is completely unresolved?" asks MarketBeat. The "most important reason" is computerized short-term trading - fundamentals "don’t matter to the tradebots." Also, "the market’s playing headline roulette," traders need to make up for losses yesterday and the stocks have hit a bottom of some sort.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 7 Comments
  • AMAP

    China's AutoNavi (AMAP +3.3%) is one more company moving due to Apple's mapping/navigation...

    China's AutoNavi (AMAP +3.3%) is one more company moving due to Apple's mapping/navigation announcements. Goldman says it believes AutoNavi, rather than TomTom (previous), will supply iOS mapping data and location services in China. The firm points out Apple and TomTom don't have local map data/service licenses, and checks indicate AutoNavi's maps are already used in the Chinese beta version of iOS 6. Also, Apple has already struck deals with many Chinese service providers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • WBS

    Webster Financial (WBS +2.9%) trades up after Sandler O'Neill upped it to Buy on valuation...

    Webster Financial (WBS +2.9%) trades up after Sandler O'Neill upped it to Buy on valuation earlier today, citing the company's improving fundamentals.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • ELGX

    Endologix (ELGX +1.8%) pipeline looks impressive, says Oppenheimer. After meeting with...

    Endologix (ELGX +1.8%) pipeline looks impressive, says Oppenheimer. After meeting with management, the firm says ELGX's growth story remains intact and that abdominal aortic aneurysm market volumes and pricing remain solid. The firm thinks the Street is still underestimating the value of the company's Nelix treatment and reiterates a Buy on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +1.2%) Q2 comp trends are looking positive , says Oppenheimer. The firm...

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +1.2%) Q2 comp trends are looking positive , says Oppenheimer. The firm notes evidence that merchandising and inventory controls are continuing to gain momentum, and downside risk is limited. The stock remains a top back-half pick.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • GIL

    Gildan Activewear (GIL +7.4%) gets a pop from an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Buckingham...

    Gildan Activewear (GIL +7.4%) gets a pop from an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Buckingham earlier today, citing solid demand trends and favorable cotton costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • AONEQ

    Though off the day's highs, A123 Systems (AONE +36.5%) is still posting huge gains on account of...

    Though off the day's highs, A123 Systems (AONE +36.5%) is still posting huge gains on account of its battery tech announcement. Short-covering is likely driving the rally (23.5% of A123's float was shorted as of May 15), as may hopes that the cash-strapped company's breakthrough will allow it to avoid bankruptcy. Technology Review notes A123's tech could both reduce the cost of an electric car battery pack by 10%-20%, and replace lead-acid batteries in conventional cars.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +4.4%) moves up after saying results from a Phase 2 study of...

    Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +4.4%) moves up after saying results from a Phase 2 study of rHuPH20, a prandial insulin, met its primary endpoint for blood sugar measurement in patients with Type 1 diabetes. Additionally, data from the study further indicated that rHuPH20 also reduced postprandial glycemic excursions, as well as significantly reduced hypoglycemic events.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -5.5%) shares plunge suddenly on a report that the company's Durata...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -5.5%) shares plunge suddenly on a report that the company's Durata defribilator is linked to a cable defect. STJ has had a similar problem with its Riata lead, which is no longer on the market; the company has said Durata leads, which it still sells, don't have the problem because they use a different type of insulation material.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • NAV

    The selloff in Navistar (NAV -11.5%) gathers steam after a federal appeals court vacates an EPA...

    The selloff in Navistar (NAV -11.5%) gathers steam after a federal appeals court vacates an EPA rule that would have allowed the company to sell heavy-duty diesel truck engines that fail to meet the latest pollution standards for engine exhaust. The ruling was a big win for NAV's competitors, who initially filed the suit: Cummins (CMI +2.3%), Volvo AB (OTCPK:VOLVY +1.2%) and Daimler AG (DDAIY.PK +0.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • ES-OLD

    A day late, and several dollars short: Avondale Partners cuts shares of EnergySolutions (ES-OLD...

    A day late, and several dollars short: Avondale Partners cuts shares of EnergySolutions (ES-OLD +6.2%) to Market Perform and lowers its price target to $3 from $8 following the company's reduced FY12 EBITDA outlook - and yesterday's resulting 54% nosedive in the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +13.5%) jumps and helps fuel a broader rally in solar stocks (TAN +4%) after...

    First Solar (FSLR +13.5%) jumps and helps fuel a broader rally in solar stocks (TAN +4%) after stating it will hold off on closing a German solar module plant (previous) until year's end due to strong Euro demand, and is actually increasing the plant's output for the time being.The plant was originally scheduled to be shuttered in October. 48.2% of First Solar's float was shorted as of May 15, and shares remain down sharply over the last 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • URI

    Morgan Stanley starts coverage on United Rentals (URI +6%) at Overweight with a $46 price...

    Morgan Stanley starts coverage on United Rentals (URI +6%) at Overweight with a $46 price target, saying the acquisition of RSC Holdings creates "an industry leader" poised to capitalize on multiple favorable secular trends and an awaited recovery in U.S. construction. The firm's channel checks lead it to expect a strong Q2 and for deal synergies to kick in almost immediately.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRMN

    Garmin (GRMN +3.1%) recoups some of yesterday's Apple-induced losses (I, II) after Dougherty...

    Garmin (GRMN +3.1%) recoups some of yesterday's Apple-induced losses (I, II) after Dougherty upgrades shares to Buy on a belief the company's recent selloff is overdone. On the other hand, TeleNav (TNAV -6.3%) is off again as the Street digests the implications of TomTom's deal to provide Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) with mapping data for its home-grown mapping and navigation services.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT +3.1%) signs an agreement with NetJets for delivery of up to 150 of TXT's Citation...

    Textron (TXT +3.1%) signs an agreement with NetJets for delivery of up to 150 of TXT's Citation Latitude business jets, with initial deliveries beginning in 2016. The confirmation comes after NetJets announced plans to buy up to 425 aircraft from TXT's Cessna division and Bombardier worth up to $9.6B, the largest-ever purchase of private planes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • GNMK

    GenMark Diagnostics (NASDAQ:GNMK) +6.6% after it raises its Q2 revenue guidance to $3.2M-$3.6M...

    GenMark Diagnostics (NASDAQ:GNMK) +6.6% after it raises its Q2 revenue guidance to $3.2M-$3.6M and says it expects to exceed $15M in the full year vs. a prior prediction of $10M. That's above consensus of $2.4M for Q2 and $12M for the year. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • CIEN

    Ciena (CIEN +1.7%) catches a bid following positive commentary in the wake of its recent...

    Ciena (CIEN +1.7%) catches a bid following positive commentary in the wake of its recent investor day. Nomura (Buy) expects Ciena's strong revenue growth and relatively fixed operating expenses to drive margin expansion, while Needham (Buy) notes Ciena remains confident about its outlook in spite of macro concerns due to the strong uptake for its 100G optical transmission gear.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier (HFC +3.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Argus, which says HFC's "refineries...

    HollyFrontier (HFC +3.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Argus, which says HFC's "refineries are well situated to take advantage of WTI's discount to other crudes, and have access to cheaper Canadian crudes and product shortfalls in PADD 2." The firm adds that the refineries are more insulated from falling gasoline demand than those of some rivals.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Labs (BRLI +6.5%) pops after BofA Merrill Lynch ups the shares to Buy, citing how...

    Bio-Reference Labs (BRLI +6.5%) pops after BofA Merrill Lynch ups the shares to Buy, citing how the returns on the commercialization of its high-end tests in a number of high-growth specialty niches are starting to bear fruit. Additionally, reimbursement headwinds and new billing codes are more likely to disproportionately impact small players, which gives BRLI the opportunity to capture market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • GSK

    Baird calls rumors of a GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +1.7%) takeout of Biomarin (BMRN +2.2%) "gossip"...

    Baird calls rumors of a GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +1.7%) takeout of Biomarin (BMRN +2.2%) "gossip" after an article in the Telegraph suggested the company was in " advanced" talks to acquire the drug developer. Baird notes many details were lacking in the report, and, more curiously, is that such a deal would happen before "transformational data readouts" from clinical studies that are expected by the end of the year. A "takeout does make sense, just not now," the firm asserts.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • EQNR

    Statoil (STO +1.4%) signs a deal to buy a floating production, storage and offloading unit from...

    Statoil (STO +1.4%) signs a deal to buy a floating production, storage and offloading unit from Maersk for an undisclosed figure. The unit has been used at the STO-operated Peregrino field offshore Brazil since production start-up in 2011; Peregrino has a storage capacity of 1.6M bbls of oil and produced at least 15M bbls during its first year of operation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • HAR

    Audio hardware maker Harman (HAR -4.8%) sells off for the second day in a row due to concerns...

    Audio hardware maker Harman (HAR -4.8%) sells off for the second day in a row due to concerns about the impact of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) just-announced partnerships with several top automakers to integrate Siri with their in-vehicle electronics. A feature called "Eyes Free" will allow drivers to activate Siri with the press of a button on the steering wheel, and could lead to some car buyers opting for the automakers' audio systems instead of Harman's.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK +4.9%) shares spike ahead of the start of the company's annual shareholder...

    SanDisk (SNDK +4.9%) shares spike ahead of the start of the company's annual shareholder meeting; for what it's worth, some attribute the surge to renewed M&A chatter.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • NAV

    Sterne Agee weighs in on reports yesterday that Navistar (NAV -3%) is considering selling...

    Sterne Agee weighs in on reports yesterday that Navistar (NAV -3%) is considering selling itself, saying it sees "reasonable merit" in its potential, but progress on any deal will likely be slow. The firm maintains a $50 target and Buy rating on Navistar.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P -6.9%) trades lower after BTIG's Richard Greenfield, who has long maintained a...

    Pandora (P -6.9%) trades lower after BTIG's Richard Greenfield, who has long maintained a bearish stance on the company, expresses concerns about the growing popularity of Songza, a mobile app that streams music from playlists "organized by activity, genre, decade, mood, and culture." A solid majority of Pandora streaming now takes place via mobile devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 6 Comments
  • LSTR

    Landstar System (LSTR -1.9%) slips after being downgraded to Equal Weight on valuation at...

    Landstar System (LSTR -1.9%) slips after being downgraded to Equal Weight on valuation at Stephens, citing flatbed pricing concerns. The firm also lowers its price target to $57 from $61.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • APL

    Atlas Pipeline (APL +4%) trades higher on news that the partnership will be added to the Alerian...

    Atlas Pipeline (APL +4%) trades higher on news that the partnership will be added to the Alerian MLP Index following the close of business on June 15; Alliance Holdings (AHGP -3.6%), Niska Gas Storage Partners (NKA -4.4%) and Exterran Partners (EXLP -6.2%) will be removed.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 2 Comments
  • PAY

    Verifone (PAY -6.6%) slumps after receiving an unfavorable verdict in a patent-infringement suit...

    Verifone (PAY -6.6%) slumps after receiving an unfavorable verdict in a patent-infringement suit filed against it by privately-owned Cardsoft. A jury ruled VeriFone owes Cardsoft a royalty of $3/unit on payment systems that are deemed to be infringing on the latter's IP. Though appealing the ruling, VeriFone is taking a $17.6M charge on account of it, and says its annual EPS will be impacted by $0.02 if it has to pay royalties on future sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -7.6%) plummets to new lows on yet another negative note (previous) from Cowen's...

    Zynga (ZNGA -7.6%) plummets to new lows on yet another negative note (previous) from Cowen's Doug Creutz, who reports the company's daily active users fell significantly for the second straight month on the back of declining usage for nearly all of its games. Creutz suspects interest in PC-based Facebook (FB +1.6%) gaming may have peaked as users shift their attention to mobile games (ed: it's also possible intensifying PC competition is hurting Zynga).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 8 Comments
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) +6.3% after announcing an OEM deal with Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) in which the...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) +6.3% after announcing an OEM deal with Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) in which the company will provide its flash memory modules for use in Cisco's fast-growing UCS server line. Piper (Overweight), which predicted the Cisco deal back in April, reiterates its forecast that Cisco could become a 10% customer by next year. Fusion-io already has OEM deals with IBM, H-P, and Dell.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • TGX

    Theragenics (NYSE:TGX) +18.7% premarket after announcing plans to repurchase up to $10M of its...

    Theragenics (NYSE:TGX) +18.7% premarket after announcing plans to repurchase up to $10M of its common stock in a modified dutch auction tender offer. Shareholders would be able to tender some or all of their shares at a price within a range of $2.00-$2.40/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Market preview: Europe's higher and so are U.S. stock futures, with the S&P benchmark +0.6%,...

    Market preview: Europe's higher and so are U.S. stock futures, with the S&P benchmark +0.6%, but nothing much has changed since the Spanish bailout joy fizzled out yesterday. And as with yesterday, yields on 10-year Italian and Spanish bonds are up sharply, perhaps providing a better reflection of reality. Back home, Michael Kors surges 12.2% following a very good FQ4 report. Later: IBD/TIPP Economic Optimism, Treasury Budget
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CY

    Premarket gainers: RMTR +33%. TGX +18%. AONE +14%. KORS +13%. FIO +6%. Losers: NSM -6%.

    Premarket gainers: RMTR +33%. TGX +18%. AONE +14%. KORS +13%. FIO +6%.
    Losers: NSM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:BMRN) +4.8% premarket on rumors that Glaxo (NYSE:GSK) is in...

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:BMRN) +4.8% premarket on rumors that Glaxo (NYSE:GSK) is in advanced discussions toward a $5B buyout of BMRN. Last week, Shire (SHPGY, OTCPK:SHPGF) also was said to be stalking the company. Glaxo is already engaged in a hostile $2.6B takeover bid for Human Genome Sciences.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • BA

    Boeing (NYSE:BA) +1.3% premarket after Bernstein upgrades shares to Outperform from Market...

    Boeing (NYSE:BA) +1.3% premarket after Bernstein upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform and lifts its price target to $92 from $85. The firm suggests investors "ignore" negative earnings revisions and focus on the production rate and delivery of BA's 787 commercial model, and believes BA's recent share price decline "is an overreaction to macroeconomic difficulties."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • CY

    Cypress Semi (NASDAQ:CY) submits a proposal to Ramtron (RMTR) to acquire all of its outstanding...

    Cypress Semi (NASDAQ:CY) submits a proposal to Ramtron (RMTR) to acquire all of its outstanding stock for $2.48/share in cash, representing a 37% premium to RMTR's June 11 closing stock price. RMTR +26% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE) +16.3% premarket after introducing a "breakthrough" lithium ion battery that...

    A123 Systems (AONE) +16.3% premarket after introducing a "breakthrough" lithium ion battery that optimizes performance in extreme temperatures. The nanophosphate EXT cells will be produced next year, and the technology will reduce the need for systems in electric cars to maintain a consistent battery temperature, helping solve a major cost issue.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • CPRI

    More on Michael Kors (KORS) FQ4: Net profit jumps to $43.6M from $13.6M, driven by strong...

    More on Michael Kors (KORS) FQ4: Net profit jumps to $43.6M from $13.6M, driven by strong performances across the company's retail, wholesale and licensing ops. Guidance: FQ1 EPS of $0.18-$0.20 vs. consensus of $0.17, and revenue of $360M-$370M vs. $323.98M; FY EPS of $1.08-$1.12 vs. $0.69, and revenue of $1.7B-$1.8B vs. $1.28B. Shares soar 13.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
